text:
300 Rivington Street, at Lewis Street, North side showing P.S. 88.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.

1920.

(1)
Mangin Street, west side, north from and including Rivington, to and including East Houston Streets. Also shown is Nos. 330-336 Rivington Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Mangin Street, (as seen across clearance). Note stables at Nos. 81-95 Mangin Street.
September 18, 1935.

P L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a point further northward, and showing a closer view of stables.
September 18, 1935.

P L. Sperr.

(1)
Mangin Street, west side, north from and including Rivington, to and including East Houston Streets. Also shown is Nos. 330-336 Rivington Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Mangin Street, (as seen across clearance). Note stables at Nos. 81-95 Mangin Street.
September 18, 1935.

P L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a point further northward, and showing a closer view of stables.
September 18, 1935.

P L. Sperr.

326-28 and 330 Rivington Street, north side, between Mangin and Goerck Streets, showing at the first number the Dr. Simon Baruch Public Baths, as viewed across a clearance at the S.W. corner of Mangin; the Photographer viewing in a north-westward direction. View No. 2 shows solely the Bath from evidently an extension of the aforementioned clearance.

September 8, 1935.
View 2: June 29, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

1
2 Ney # 716

326-28 and 330 Rivington Street, north side, between Mangin and Goerck Streets, showing at the first number the Dr. Simon Baruch Public Baths, as viewed across a clearance at the S.W. corner of Mangin; the Photographer viewing in a north-westward direction. View No. 2 shows solely the Bath from evidently an extension of the aforementioned clearance.

September 8, 1935.
View 2: June 29, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

1
2 Ney # 716

Rivington Street, north side, west from Goerck Street, showing tenements interspersed with clearances. Upon the one in the foreground, which is between Goerck and Lewis Streets, stood three tenements that bore No's 314 to 318. To the west is the present recreation lot where former P.S. No. 88 formerly stood at the N.W. corner of Rivington and Lewis Streets. Note on the left margin a bare outline and the spire of the De Witt Memorial Church.

June 29, 1938.

P.L. Sperr
